description.narrative: B-READY has now been tested in the Philippines (B.Ready A-05666), and has initial funding to be piloted in Sudan. To make the jump from ‘pilot’ to ‘preparing for scale’ B-READY needs to: 1. Evidence the current B-READY Model for iterative improvement, advocacy and impact: The project will cover 2 new locations in the Philippines, and continue in its current operational area to generate evidence including a Randomized Control Trial, to create iterative improvement, advocacy materials and build B-READY for adoption. 2. Codification of the B-READY Philippines and Global Scale Model includes mapping similar initiatives elsewhere for collaboration or learning, considering ‘fertile’ areas for scale up (financing, locations, actors, policy routes), choosing astrategic scale up trajectorybased on lessons learned, and then a collaborative codification process linking the Philippines National Model, with a Global ScaleModel and ‘testing’ these with new funders and implementers to ensure greatest impact, cost-efficiency and ethical risk management. 3. Building B-READY for Sustainability at Scale by practically testing local and global sustainability pathways through government uptake (Philippines), private sector finance business models, global FbF, and pre-emptive financial tools/mechanisms currently under-discussion. Furthermore, there will be global advocacy, influencing and knowledge sharing, having B-READY and its Scale Model featured in many appropriate forums, exposure visits, webinar presentations, socialisation workshops, targeted policy papers, and discussions with strategic actors to build new partners for adoption. Oxfam in Philippines capacity is based on advocacy, resilience, localhumanitarian leadership, digital financial inclusion and cash programming, for which they have received awards from Google and the Australian Government on accelerating financial inclusion with technology. They will provide technical advice, finance private sector oversight, coordination of actors, advocacy in country, gathering evidence and codification of B-READY. Oxfam PH will be the main project implementer in the Philippines, sub granting to several local partner organizations. Oxfam PH will also contract the project auditor.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain#s Philippine office has been in existence since 1987. It has maintained a developmental program in the country that has gradually shifted from relief and basic services provision to a more rights-based developmental approach. Oxfam Great Britain has supported community-based coastal resources management since the early 1990s, as an approach towards an integration of coastal ecosystem rehabilitation, poverty alleviation, and political equity concerns for small-scale sectors. Oxfam inthe Philippines works towards a future where Filipinos, especially women and other vulnerable sectors, are free from the injustices of poverty. During emergencies, we respond with life-saving aid while supporting people recover their livelihoods. Everyday, we drive change by working hand-in-hand with our partners in finding practical yet innovative ways to help families lift themselves out of poverty by influencing decisions that affect them.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: Improved policies : # of cases where Oxfam Novib’s/partners' influencing has contributed to adopting and/or implementing gender sensitive policies by (sub)national governments or global actors on Disaster Risk Reduction and Preparedness.

cases where Oxfam Novib’s/partners' influencing has contributed to adopting and/or implementing gender sensitive policies by (sub)national governments or global actors on Disaster Risk Reduction and Preparedness.

comment.narrative: In identifying beneficiaries of preemptive cash transfers, the Barangay and Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Councils (BDRRMC and MDRRMC) gave utmost importance to the vulnerability and financial indices. In profiling the participants, households considered were those with one or more of the following: with women as head of the family, with Persons with Disabilities, with (malnourished) children and/or with senior members.

comment.narrative: A policy note and policy brief on how to institutionalize B-READY in the Philippines were prepared and shared with the Anticipatory Action (AA) Technical Working Group in the Philippines.

comment.narrative: The report of the Learning Event on Typhoon Rai Experience captures how all involved actors (including local government) have performed there tasks as per the B-Ready model
